text: My name is Ravi Nemalikanti.
I'm the Chief Product and Technology Officer of Abrigo.

We are a leading provider of compliance,
credit risk,

and lending solutions to over 2,400
financial institutions in the US.
In 2023, Abrigo decided to move all products to AWS
Our migration timeline was very aggressive.

We wanted to exit our data centers
within a 12 month period.

We worked very closely with the AWS
Professional Services to ensure that

the migration itself
was done very seamlessly,

as well as our team's readiness in 
taking over our workloads on day one.

By working with AWS security experts,
we make sure that we are delivering

on the overall migration timeline.
We want to make sure that automation

was in place to ensure
that our deployments were not getting

disrupted during the process
and after the migration.

We also leveraged AWS security 
experts to ensure that

we have our security
baked into our infrastructure

as code and security as code.
We had to upskill our teams,

which meant we relied heavily on AWS
trainings and certifications

to ensure that we had learning 
pathways for our employees

We migrated our entire set of products
within a span of 12 months.

We were able to deploy products
to production at a much faster pace.
What used to take hours now takes minutes.

From a disaster recovery perspective,
we were able to reduce

our total cost footprint by 70%
because we no longer needed to have

bare metal and all 
the hardware and software

we had to have in place
from a regulatory perspective.

Our overall deployment
frequency has gone up 4x.
Our deployment time reduced by 50%.
Our speed to market increased by over 60%.

Abrigo works with AWS 
Professional Services, security consultants,

and multiple other teams,
to ensure that we had the best

security profile as we migrated 2,400
financial institutions to AWS.
